conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle underwent variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
From t = 0 to t = 1 second, the velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
Since the velocity is constant from t = 0 to t = 1 second, the particle is undergoing uniform motion.
From t = 1 to t = 2 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
The linear decrease in velocity from t = 1 to t = 2 seconds indicates deceleration and variable motion.
From t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
The continued decrease in velocity from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds indicates continued variable motion.
In the first second, the particle is moving with uniform velocity. From 1 to 3 seconds, the particle is undergoing variable linear motion.
Yes, the particle underwent variable linear motion during the second and third seconds.
